page.title: 03BEECH TREES IN THE CHILTERNS
page.content: The Beech is one of the most beautiful forest trees. In Winter when the tall massive truncks are covered with smooth grey green bark it is displayed to advantages. It enormous branches come off at an angle or almost horizontally to produce a gigantic crown. In spring and summer the dense foliage casts a shade deeper than that of any other broad-leaved tree and above all in autumn the foliage turns to blazing red goldern brown. The woods around the Risborough area are mainly beech and near the famous Whiteleaf Cross thet are particular beautiful. In early summer the trees are out in full, birds are singing,grey squirrels run around the ground and shoot up the trees, and everybody is enjoying the early summer sun.
